moves.1. e4 d6 2. d4 Nf6 3. Bd3 Nbd7 4. f4 e5: Qc7 seems normal but white has a Lot  hidden in this possition
moves.11. e5: from this point the endless attack
moves.11... Nd5: this seems fine move if the queen not in C7
moves.12... Kxh7 13. Qc2+: but  it is not  a sacrifice here because the Qc7 move
moves.13... Kg8 14. Nxd5: queen has to lose tempo and must move to d8
moves.14... Qd8 15. Nxe7+: this move is needed so the  other  knight get to g5 and continue the attack
moves.15... Qxe7 16. Ng5 g6 17. e6: normal move  black cant take the  pawn

moves.20... c5: trying to open the  black  diagonal
moves.21. Rae1: getting  the last piece out to the  center
moves.22. Be5: protecting the  pawn and pin the knight
moves.22... cxd4 23. g4: g4 force the  bishop to move and lose the pinned knight
moves.25... Qd6 26. Re4: if the  bishop moves any where except  h4  Rh4#
